meanings.sent1: The children's stramash could be heard from across the playground.
meanings.sent2: The party turned into a stramash when the music got louder.
meanings.sent3: The stramash of pots and pans clattering in the kitchen made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The sudden stramash of birds taking flight startled the hikers.
meanings.sent5: The stramash of the thunderstorm outside made it hard to concentrate.

meanings.definition: To cause a disturbance or commotion.
meanings.sent1: Please don't stramash the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent2: The protesters planned to stramash the city council meeting.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy managed to stramash the quiet library.
meanings.sent4: Her unexpected arrival at the party stramashed the guests.
meanings.sent5: The loud music from the car stramashed the peaceful neighborhood.
